Row.Text: I am Robert Borden, Prime Minister of the Dominion of Canada. We stand ready to do our duty on the world stage.
Come, let me show you our Parliament. We are building a nation here, not merely a colony.
A capital tour would be most welcome. I accept your gracious invitation.
Let us exchange information about our capitals. Knowledge of one's neighbors is the beginning of diplomacy.
Good day to you.
Your delegation will be received with all the hospitality Canada can offer. We welcome honest discourse between nations.
I must decline. The current circumstances do not permit such formalities.
I am sending a delegation to your court. They carry with them Canadian maple syrup and a genuine desire for friendship.
Canada's borders are open to those who respect our sovereignty. Your troops may pass.
I cannot permit foreign troops upon Canadian soil at this time. Surely you understand.
Would you grant passage to Canadian forces? We seek only to position ourselves strategically in these uncertain times.
I gladly accept your hand in friendship. Together, nations of goodwill can accomplish what none can alone.
Your actions speak louder than your words. I must decline this offer of friendship.
Let us formalize the bonds between our peoples. Will you declare friendship with Canada?
Excellent. A leader who honors their commitments is a leader worth knowing.
A disappointing decision, but one I must respect. For now.
It is the duty of the state to maintain its existence, and this duty is best fulfilled through strong alliances. Will you stand with Canada?
You honor your alliances and stand by your word. This is the mark of a true statesman. Well done!
You abandon your allies when they need you most. This is cowardice, plain and simple. Do better.
Your troops mass at our borders. If you seek war, we will give it to you. If you seek peace, withdraw them.
A fair arrangement. Canada accepts.
This proposal does not serve Canadian interests. I must decline.
Denounce me if you will. Canada has faced far greater challenges than your empty rhetoric.
You have proven yourself unworthy of trust or respect. The world must know of your duplicity. (Denounces You)
(You have abandoned your allies and refused to honor your commitments.)
Then war it shall be. Canada will do its duty, no matter the cost.
I did not seek this conflict, but I will not shrink from it. The Canadian Corps will show you what duty and sacrifice truly mean.
Enough blood has been spilled. Let us end this conflict and rebuild what has been destroyed.
No. We will see this through to the bitter end.
This war serves neither of us. Let us negotiate terms and spare our peoples further suffering.
Canada has fallen, but the principles for which we fought will endure. History will judge which of us was right.
You fought with courage, if not wisdom. Let this be a lesson in the importance of honoring one's alliances.
